H0.text: Two meters is the approximate length of the DNA from all 46 chromosomes in a human cell nucleus when laid out end to end.

H1.text: Three meters is the approximate length of the DNA from all 46 chromosomes in a human cell nucleus when laid out end to end.

H2.text: Four meters is the approximate length of the DNA from all 46 chromosomes in a human cell nucleus when laid out end to end.

H3.text: One meter is the approximate length when the DNA from all 46 chromosomes in a human cell nucleus is laid out end to end.

A4.text: The total amount of DNA in this reference genome is 3.1 billion base pairs.

A5.text: Most human cells are diploid so they contain twice as much DNA (~6.2 billion base pairs).
